bill_title: to provide for six-person juries in small claims actions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for six-person juries in small claims actions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 15-14-27 be amended to read as follows: 15-14-27. In all civil actions cognizable by a magistrate judge, except actions for the forcible entry and detainer, or detainer only, of real property, tried in the circuit court, the verdict may be rendered by five-sixths In any small claims action, pursuant to chapter 15-39, the jury shall consist of six persons. Unless otherwise agreed to by the parties, the jury's verdict or findings shall be rendered by five-sixths of the jury in the manner provided in § § 15-14-28 and 15-14-29. Section 2. That § 15-14-28 be amended to read as follows: 15-14-28. In the actions mentioned provided for in § 15-14-27, when the jury have agreed upon their verdict , they must shall be conducted into court, their names shall be called by the clerk and the verdict shall be rendered by their foreman. The verdict must shall be in writing signed by the foreman and must shall be read by the clerk to the jury and the inquiry made whether it is their verdict. If four two or more of the jury disagree , they must shall be sent out again. If nine five of the jury agree to the verdict , it shall be the verdict of the jury and so recorded. Section 3. That § 15-14-29 be amended to read as follows: 15-14-29. If neither party in an action mentioned provided for in § 15-14-27 requires the jury to be polled , the verdict is complete and the jury shall be discharged from the case. Either party may require the jury to be polled, which is shall be done by the court or clerk asking each juror if it is his or her verdict. If more than three answer one answers in the negative , the jury must shall be sent out.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for six-person juries in small claims actions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 15-14-27 be amended to read as follows: 15-14-27. The Unified Judicial System is authorized to execute a pilot program implementing the provisions of this Act in one judicial circuit of the state beginning on July 1, 1997, and to continue for a period of one year to determine the practicability and feasibility of providing the right to a jury trial in small claims actions. The Unified Judicial System shall prepare an impact analysis of the effects of this Act on the judicial system to be available during the 1998 legislative session.
